# Function name: options
# Notes:
# .blue[`options()`]
.small[
.center[.blue[`options`]`(*option* = *value*)`]
]
+ The .blue[`options()`] function sets the global behavior used by R, including how numbers are printed/formatted.  
+ Some packages allow you to set default behavior.
  + For example, you can turn off messages about how .blue[`summarise()`] function behaves in .blue[`dplyr`] with this option:
```{r}
options(dplyr.summarise.inform=FALSE)
```
